p: Standard strains of L. infantum (MHOM/BR/1972/BH46) and L. amazonensis (IFLA/BR/1967/PH8) were used for in vitro antileishmania assays. Amastigote forms were routinely isolated from infected Golden hamsters ( Mesocricetus auratus) and maintained as promastigotes in Schneider’s Insect Medium (Sigma-Aldrich ®) supplemented with 20% foetal bovine serum (Sigma-Aldrich ®) and 140 μg/mL gentamicin (Sigma-Aldrich ®) at 26 °C. On the seventh day of cultivation, promastigote forms from up to four serial passages after isolation were used in the experiments.
